definition: to write a letter (to the authorities)/to present a petition
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Anne closed her book and stood up.
I'm the lady you've looked for, write to me, and escape.
sentences.chinese: 那么我是阿谁你要找的人，给我上书，咱们一路私逃。

sentences.english: Please close your books immediately and answer these questions.
sentences.chinese: 请立即合上书，回答这些问题。

sentences.english: With this words he shut the book and left the room.
sentences.chinese: 说着他就合上书走出房去。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome …
sentences.chinese: 王太后并曾派人至罗马上书教皇及耶稣总会长。

sentences.english: They petitioned for an early end to the fighting .
sentences.chinese: 他们上书请求早日结束战争。

sentences.english: He closed the book with sharp snap, and looked over at Moroes.
sentences.chinese: 然后猛地合上书，把视线移到了摩洛斯身上。

sentences.english: He was careful to mark his place before he shut the book.
sentences.chinese: 合上书以前，他小心地作了记号。

sentences.english: At the same time Empress Wang sent envoys to Rome for pr…
sentences.chinese: 王太后并曾派人至罗马上书教皇及耶稣总会长。

definition: (of a court official) to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
to hand down an imperial edict
edict/written imperial order
imperial order
court/imperial household/dynasty
imperial order
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
an Imperial edict
to accuse of misconduct (in official task)/to impeach
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
imperial decree
memorial to the Emperor
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
chancellor (of a monarchy)/cabinet minister
